link.title: COVID-19 Distance Learning | Oregon City School District

meta.content: Our focus for Distance Learning is on WELLNESS, COMMUNITY, and CONNECTION. We miss seeing our students! Staff will be collaborating, receiving training and making preparations from March 30-April 1. You can expect to hear from one of your child’s teachers starting on Thursday, April 2nd: What To Expect and Who to Contact During Distance Learning by Schools.

li.a: Title I-A, Education for the Disadvantaged

input.title: Enter the terms you wish to search for.

div.p: Our focus for Distance Learning is on WELLNESS, COMMUNITY, and CONNECTION. We miss seeing our students! Staff will be collaborating, receiving training and making preparations from March 30-April 1.
You can expect to hear from one of your child’s teachers starting on Thursday, April 2nd: What To Expect and Who to Contact During Distance Learning by Schools.

Breakfast and lunch will continue to be provided, including through Spring Break, at designated sites until April 28th. We are grateful to community partners like Pioneer Pantry and Clackamas Bookshelf, who have provided additional food and free books to students. Please consider donating to one or both of these outstanding organizations to help sustain their important work.
Our plans are aligned with Oregon Department of Education guidance.

p.a: AP Course Announcement from The College Board

p.strong: Suggested Activities for Learning at Home When Schools are Closed

ul.li: NEW - OCSD Library Staff Read Alongs

Oregon City School District At Home Learning Choice Boards - for Supplemental Distance Learning:
Week #1 (Page 2 in Spanish)
Week #2/Spanish
Week #3/Spanish/Russian
Write - reach out to friends and family through writing
Reason Mathematically - count, calculate and measure through play or cooking (Math Links)
Reason Scientifically - explore questions based on observations (Science Links)
Exercise: OPEN Active Home Links OR ​Go Noodle at Home

p.strong: Resources for Supporting Children During Coronavirus

ul.li: Talking with children about Coronavirus Disease 2019 - CDC
Mental Health and Coping during the COVID-19 Outbreak - CDC
Talking to Children about the COVID-19 Virus - NASAP (multiple languages)
Talking to Kids about the Coronavirus - Child Mind (En Español)

div.p: After April 2, 2020, please contact your child's teacher or school with questions about distance learning.
Spanish-speaking families may call Bela Paris at 503-785-8880 x 7864.
